intro: Hieracium proteiforme, commonly known as the variable hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces yellow to orange ray flowers surrounded by numerous tubular florets, which attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Hieracium proteiforme is known for its variability in leaf shape and flower size, contributing to its common name.
